intro: Angelica pubescens, commonly known as the hairy angelica, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Angelica pubescens thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
